data.text: But Job answered and said,
Hear ye, hear ye my words,
Raise me, and I will speak;
What! is my reproof of man?
Look upon me, and wonder,
For even when I remember, I am alarmed,
Wherefore do the ungodly live,
Their seed is according to their desire,
Their houses are prosperous, neither have they anywhere cause for fear,
Their cow does not cast her calf,
And they remain as an unfailing flock,
And they rejoice at the voice of a song.
And they spend their days in wealth,
Yet such a man says to the Lord, Depart from me;
What is the Mighty One, that we should serve him?
For their good things were in their hands,
Nevertheless, the lamp of the ungodly also shall be put out,
And they shall be as chaff before the wind,
Let his substance fail to supply his children:
Let his eyes see his own destruction,
For his desire is in his house with him,
Is it not the Lord who teaches understanding and knowledge?
One shall die in his perfect strength,
And his innards are full of fat,
And another dies in bitterness of soul,
But they lie down in the earth together,
So I know you, that ye presumptuously attack me:
So that ye will say, Where is the house of the prince?
Ask those that go by the way,
For the wicked hastens to the day of destruction:
Who will tell him his way to his face, whereas he has done it?
And he has been led away to the tombs,
The stones of the valley have been sweet to him,
How then do ye comfort me in vain?
